title: CI/CD Pipeline Build Failure
description: The latest commit caused the CI/CD pipeline to fail during the build phase due to a dependency version mismatch in the Node.js application.

title: Deployment Failure on Kubernetes
description: The new version of the backend application failed to deploy to the Kubernetes cluster due to insufficient resource allocation and lack of required environment variables.

title: Container Crash Due to Memory Overflow
description: A Docker container running the application crashed due to a memory overflow caused by an unoptimized query in the backend service.

title: Kubernetes Pod Auto-Scaling Failure
description: The horizontal pod autoscaler (HPA) failed to scale the pods properly due to an issue with the defined resource requests and limits in the Kubernetes deployment manifest.

title: Monitoring System Downtime
description: The monitoring system (Prometheus and Grafana) went down due to a misconfigured alerting rule, which caused several critical service downtimes to go unnoticed.

title: Infrastructure Automation Failure
description: An issue in the Terraform script led to a failure in provisioning new infrastructure on AWS, causing delays in the deployment of new microservices.

title: Database Performance Issues
description: The MongoDB replica set encountered performance bottlenecks due to slow queries caused by missing indexes, leading to application timeouts.

title: Backup System Failure
description: The backup system failed to perform scheduled backups of the cloud database due to a misconfigured IAM role in AWS, causing potential data loss risks.

title: API Rate Limiting Issues
description: Excessive API calls from a partner integration caused the API gateway to hit rate limits, leading to service outages and delayed responses from the API.

title: Security Vulnerability in Code
description: A security vulnerability was identified in the production code due to improper sanitization of user inputs in the web application, potentially allowing SQL injection.
